intro: Chirita sericea, commonly known as silky chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Chirita sericea prefers well-draining soil and indirect sunlight, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
